DVS Classes Library

0.01

Introduction

 This static library provides a C++ wrapper for the DVS card driver API functions It provides simplified mechanisms for acquiring and outputting frames of video (through the FIFO DMA functions in the driver API).

Linking with DVSClasses

  • Put in your compiler include path /project/vp/src/dvs/include/
  • Put in your compiler include path /project/vp/src/dvs/sdk/development/header/
  • Include /project/vp/src/dvs/include/DVSClasses.h
  • Link with /project/vp/src/dvs/lib/libDVSClasses.a
  • Link with pthreads (required by libDVSClasses.a)
  • Link with /project/vp/src/dvs/sdk/linux/lib/libdvsoem.a
Ensure that you compile with C++ linkage (use g++ rather than cc).

Overview of usage

The main class provided is DVSCard which represents access to a DVS video board (there can be more than one fitted). Creating an instance of DVSCard will claim exclusive access to a DVS video board, until that instance is deleted.

The DVSCard class does not provide equivalents of all functions in the DVS driver API. There is therefore a DVSHandle class that will give you access to the DVS driver handle needed to call driver API functions.

General Info

Thread Safety

 Most class methods provided are thread-safe. All attempt to lock access to both the class, and to the DVS driver API through mutexes.

There are of course conditions which cannot be protected against - such as destroying a DVSCard object just prior to using it in another thread.

See also:
